sen.j: 六波羅（ろくはら）は京都の鴨川東岸の五条大路から七条大路一帯の地名である。
sen.e: Rokuhara is a name of a zone spanning from Gojo-oji on the east bank of Kamo River to an area around Shichijo-oji in Kyoto.

sen.j: 天暦5年（951年）空也がこの地に西光寺を創建し、後に中信 (僧)がこの寺を六波羅蜜寺と改名したことから「六波羅」と呼ばれているとされる。
sen.e: In 951, Kuya founded Saikoji (Seikoji) Temple here and it is said that Chushin (a Buddhist priest) later changed the name to Rokuharamitsuji Temple and, therefore, the zone was called Rokuhara.

sen.j: この地は洛中から京都の住民の葬地であった鳥辺野に入る際の入口にあたる事から、この他にも六道珍皇寺など沢山の寺院が建てられ、信仰の地として栄えた。
sen.e: This zone was located at the entrance for visiting Toribeno which was the place for the Kyoto residents to be buried, from the central Kyoto and, therefore, this zone had many other temples such as Rokudochinnoji (Rokudochinkoji) Temple constructed therein and was prosperous as a place of belief.

sen.j: 院政期には平正盛が一族のために供養堂を建立し、その子平忠盛が「六波羅館」を置き、ここを武家の拠点とする。
sen.e: In the days of Insei (government by cloistered emperors) here, TAIRA no Masamori constructed a memorial hall for his family and his son, TAIRA no Tadamori placed "Rokuhara yakata" and determined this yakata (residence) as the base of warriors.

sen.j: 正盛父子の伊勢平氏は、伊勢国を本拠としており、京都から伊勢や東国方面への街道が近くにある六波羅が拠点として選ばれたと考えられている。
sen.e: Ise-Heishi (Taira clan) of Masamori and his son placed their base in Ise Province and, therefore, it is considered that Rokuhara which had in its vicinity main roads leading from Kyoto to Ise and eastern provinces was selected as the base.

sen.j: 平清盛の時代に平氏政権の中心となるが、後に清盛は洛中に「西八条邸」を造営して拠点を移した。
sen.e: In the days of TAIRA no Kiyomori, Rokuhara became the center of the government by the Taira clan, however, Kiyomori later constructed his "Nishihachijo residence" in the central Kyoto and moved his base to this residence.

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）平家の都落ちの際、六波羅館は焼失した。
sen.e: When the Taira clan was exiled from Kyoto in 1183, the Rokuhara yakata was burned down.

sen.j: 平氏の都落ち後、六波羅の地は源頼朝に与えられ、京都守護となった北条時政が京都守護の庁舎を置き（後、一族の北条時定が駐留する）、頼朝や御家人の宿舎が築かれた。
sen.e: After the Taira clan was exiled from Kyoto, the zone of Rokuhara was given to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, and Tokimasa HOJO who became Kyoto shugo placed the buildings for Kyoto shugo (in which Tokisada HOJO of the Hojo clan later stationed) and residents of Yoritomo and gokenin (an immediate vasal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo period) were constructed.

sen.j: ただし、頼朝は六条堀川に河内源氏代々の館を持ち、時政以後の京都守護は公家出身者や京都在住が長い武士が多かったために自己の屋敷を庁舎としており、専ら北条氏のように京都に拠点の無い東国武士が拠点にする場合が多かったとされている。

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）、承久の乱後の朝廷へ対しての処理として、六波羅探題が置かれる。
sen.e: In 1221, rokuhara tandai (Rokuhara deputies) was founded as the disposition for the Imperial court after Jokyu no Ran (Jokyu Rebellion).

sen.e: Because Muromachi Bakufu placed its base in the central Kyoto, warriors living there decreased and temples, etc., were again constructed and, therefore, the town recovered its taste as a town of belief and became cheerful with the cultural activities targeting the visitors to temples such as entertainments and tea stands.
